Block.Description: The Measure - Color mode outputs the detected color number in Color.
The Measure – RGB mode outputs the red, green, and blue values detected by the sensor. These values can be used for custom color processing or analysis.
The Measure - Reflected Light Intensity mode outputs the light intensity in Measured Value.
The Measure - Raw Reflected Light Intensity mode outputs the unprocessed reflected light intensity value.
The Measure - Ambient Light Intensity mode outputs the light intensity in Measured Value.

In the Compare - Color mode, you can select one or more colors in the Set of Colors. The Compare Result output will be True if the detected color matches any of the selected colors. The detected color is output to Measured Value.

The Compare – RGB mode checks whether the detected red, green, and blue values fall within the specified RGB range. The result is output as True if the values are within range, or False if they are outside.

The Compare – Reflected Light Intensity and Compare – Ambient Light Intensity modes compare the detected light intensity to the Threshold Value using the selected Compare Type. The True/False result is output in Compare Result, and the detected light intensity is output in Measured Value.

The Compare – Raw Reflected Light Intensity mode compare the detected light intensity to the Threshold Value using the selected Compare Type. The True/False result is output in Compare Result, and the detected light intensity is output in Measured Value.

The Compare – Reflected Light Intensity and Compare – Ambient Light Intensity modes compare the detected light intensity to the Threshold Value using the selected Compare Type. The True/False result is output in Compare Result, and the detected light intensity is output in Measured Value.

You can wait for the Color Sensor to detect one or more specified colors. For example, you could wait for the Color Sensor to detect black. See Using the Color Sensor for more information about the Color Sensor in Color mode.Select one or more colors in the Set of Colors input. The block will wait until any one of the selected colors is detected. The detected color is output in Measured Value.

Mode: Color Sensor - Compare - RGB
Use: Waits until a color within the specified RGB range is detected.

Mode: Color Sensor - Compare - Reflected Light Intensity
Use: Wait for the reflected light intensity to reach a certain value.

Mode: Color Sensor - Compare - Ambient Light Intensity
Use: Wait for the ambient light intensity to reach a certain value.

Use: Repeat a sequence of blocks until a color within the specified RGB range is detected.

Mode: Color Sensor - Reflected Light Intensity
Use: Repeat a sequence of blocks until the reflected light intensity reaches a certain value.

Mode: Color Sensor - Ambient Light Intensity

Use: Choose between two sequences of blocks depending on whether the detected RGB value falls within a specified range.

Mode: Color Sensor - Compare - Reflected Light Intensity

Mode: Color Sensor - Compare - Ambient Light Intensity

The Calibrate – Minimum mode allows you to specify the minimum light intensity in the Value input. After calibration, the Color Sensor will report this light intensity as 0 or the value specified.
The Calibrate – Maximum mode allows you to specify the maximum light intensity in the Value input. After calibration, the Color Sensor will report this light intensity as 100 or the value specified.
The Calibrate – Reset mode restores the Color Sensor calibration to its default state.
